title: John Stones hoping to prove himself as first-choice Manchester City centre-back
text:
John Stones has praised the way young Manchester City midfielder Rodri has filled in at centre-back while he has been out injured but intends to make it clear to Pep Guardiola he should be first choice in that position.

Stones has had a difficult campaign up to this point, with some questionable performances for City after an unimpressive summer with the England team followed by a thigh injury that has kept him out for more than a month.

The loss of form has helped fuel rumours that Guardiola is starting to lose confidence in the 25-year-old, a perception that was strengthened by the fact he did not go straight back into the team following his return to fitness.

Guardiola instead elected to keep Rodri in the side that started against Crystal Palace and Atalanta, even though the Spaniard normally operates as a defensive midfielder.

A lack of game time for Stones has been used as an excuse for that decision, but with Rodri expected to be out with a hamstring injury for the next few weeks, this could be a crucial period for Stones if he is to rejuvenate his City career.
